main event: On July 7, 1956, a silver, circular, dime-sized object was observed traveling at high speeds, curving upwards and downwards over Greenwood Lake, New York. It hovered and then accelerated at high speeds, exhibiting unusual flight characteristics for about 15 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as silver, circular, about the size of a dime, displaying high-speed maneuvers including hovering, climbing, and diving.
The report indicates limited information and the need for additional investigation to rule out the possibility of a hoax.
The document was classified as 'FOR OFFICIAL USE ONLY' and involved multiple notifications of reclassification or designation of classified information.

Witnesses reported observing a bright, silvery, disc-shaped object hovering over Greenwood Lake at an altitude of 300-400 feet before accelerating rapidly and disappearing, with a reported speed of over 1000 mph.
A flying white light was observed moving rapidly, stopping suddenly for 1 to 2 minutes, and then taking off and disappearing to the west-northwest, with no sound.
sighted object: silver, circular, dime-sized object displaying high-speed maneuvers
